item.title: Acer gives its 18-inch Predator Helios gaming laptop a 4K screen and top GPU

review.headline_rewrite: Acer gives its 18-inch Predator Helios gaming laptop a 4K screen and top GPU
bullets: Acer is refreshing some of its gaming laptops for IFA 2025, with a big new Predator Helios 18P AI at the high end and pair of more affordable Nitro V 16 models.

Acer gives its 18-inch Predator Helios gaming laptop a 4K screen and top GPU
The new Predator Helios 18P has an RTX 5090, while the refreshed Acer Nitro V 16 and 16S get 5070 options.

The Predator Helios 18P will have up to an RTX 5090 GPU and Intel Core Ultra 9 285HX processor, though in any configuration it should come with a 18-inch 4K / 120Hz Mini LED display and two Thunderbolt 5 ports (among many other ports).
The 18P’s availability and North American price is still TBD, but it’s sure to be up there since it’ll start at 4,999 euros.
At the more affordable end, the new Acer Nitro V 16 and 16S are launching in October and November, respectively.
Both 16-inchers can go up to an Intel 270H processor and RTX 5070 GPU.

item.title: Google will reveal its Gemini smart home plans (and hardware) next month

review.headline_rewrite: Google will reveal its Gemini smart home plans (and hardware) next month
bullets:
The company has teased some sort of launch or announcement for that day, promising that “Gemini is coming to Google Home.”
Google will reveal its Gemini smart home plans (and hardware) next month
An official teaser points to a new Nest Cam and more Gemini for Home announcements in October.
The company announced Gemini for Home at last month’s Made by Google event, promising early access would begin in October, so a dedicated event with more details before things kick off makes sense.
Google’s AI assistant will eventually replace Google Assistant across the smart home, theoretically enabling natural language interactions and more intuitive controls.

Google’s teaser includes a glimpse of a Nest Cam, and while it looks the spitting image of existing hardware, we expect it’s a new model, rumored to launch soon alongside a new Nest Doorbell, both featuring 2K camera support.
There’s also the small matter of the unknown Nest speaker glimpsed during the recent launch stream, which we expect to be at the center of Google’s new home hardware.

item.title: Acer's new gaming lineup includes an 18-inch AI laptop and a 720Hz monitor

review.headline_rewrite: Acer's new gaming lineup includes an 18-inch AI laptop and a 720Hz monitor
bullets: Acer maintains two different gaming product lines and it's updating both of them at IFA 2025.

The updated Predator Helios 18P AI is an even more powerful version of the Predator Helio 18 the company showed off at CES 2024, offering "desktop-level AI" in what's still technically a portable body.
Inside, you can get up to an Intel Core Ultra 9 processor, a NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5090 laptop GPU and 6TB of SSD storage.
Acer has new gaming desktop PCs, the Predator Orion 7000 and Orion 5000, which can use GeForce RTX 5090 or 5080 GPUs, respectively.
The Acer Nitro V 16 can be built with up to an Intel Core 9 processor and a NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5070 laptop GPU.
The laptop has up to an Intel Core 9 processor, but only a NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5070 laptop GPU, the same 180Hz display, in a metal body that's 19.9mm thin.

item.title: Acer's Swift 16 Air laptop weighs less than 2.2 pounds

review.headline_rewrite: Acer's Swift 16 Air laptop weighs less than 2.2 pounds
bullets: Acer just unveiled the new Swift 16 Air laptop at IFA 2025.
The 16-inch laptop clocks in at just over two pounds, which is lighter than a 13-inch MacBook Air.
The Swift 16 Air is available with two display options.
These computers are powered by AMD Ryzen AI 300 Series processors, with options up to the AI 7 350.
They also come with AMD Radeon GPUs.
These include a pair of USB-C ports, two USB-A ports and an HDMI port.

item.title: Missing minute in Jeffrey Epstein jail security video revealed in document dump

review.headline_rewrite: Missing minute in Jeffrey Epstein jail security video revealed in document dump

bullets:
Grammarly launches new AI agents to assist students and professionals with writing tasks
Grammarly has introduced eight new AI agents within its AI writing surface, 'docs,' designed to aid students and professionals with diverse writing tasks.
These agents offer functionalities like citation finding, plagiarism checking, and AI detection, alongside features predicting reader reactions and providing rubric-based feedback.
This launch signifies Grammarly's move towards agent-based AI to enhance writing across various platforms.
